Interface IUtil

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Util

    public interface IUtil
    A class containing useful methods
    Since:
    23 ‎July, ‎2018

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      weka.core.Instances arrayListOfFeaturesToInstances(java.util.ArrayList<Feature> features)
      Creates a list off Attribute objects from a list of Feature objects.
      java.util.List<Accelerometer> normalize(java.util.List<Accelerometer> inputList, double min, double max)
      Function that does a min-max normalization on the given input in accordance with the formula: y = (x - min) / (max - min)
      java.util.List<Accelerometer> preprocess(java.util.List<Accelerometer> inputData)
      Function that preprocesses an input list based on the given settings regarding preprocessing threshold and interval in the Settings class.

    • Method Detail

      • arrayListOfFeaturesToInstances

        weka.core.Instances arrayListOfFeaturesToInstances(java.util.ArrayList<Feature> features)
        Creates a list off Attribute objects from a list of Feature objects.
        Parameters:
        features - the ArrayList containing the Feature objects
        Returns:
        ArrayList containing the resulting Attribute objects
        Since:
        23 ‎July, ‎2018

      • preprocess

        java.util.List<Accelerometer> preprocess(java.util.List<Accelerometer> inputData)
        Function that preprocesses an input list based on the given settings regarding preprocessing threshold and interval in the Settings class.
        Parameters:
        inputData - a List containing the Accelerometer data
        Returns:
        the preprocessed list

      • normalize

        java.util.List<Accelerometer> normalize(java.util.List<Accelerometer> inputList,
                                        double min,
                                        double max)
        Function that does a min-max normalization on the given input in accordance with the formula: y = (x - min) / (max - min)
        Parameters:
        inputList - the Accelerometer data
        min - the minimum value for the normalization
        max - the maximum value for the normalization
        Returns:
        the normalized list
